New Records: Rilee Rossouw became the first Proteas man to reach a century in the men's T20 World Cup
Quinton de Kock and Rilee Rossouw put on a tournament record 163 for the second wicket in 13.3 overs
Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje and Kagiso Rabada ran riot in the powerplay
Shakib al Hasan's dismissal to a ball pitching outside leg stump summed up their fortunes
Pre-Game Insights: Rain before play and early into the South Africa innings raised fears of a second washout in as many games for De Kock's side
Though Temba Bevuma's problems continued with a seventh single-figure T20I score in a row
Post-Match Reflections: A late cameo with the ball from Tabraiz Shamsi secured South Africa's second-largest T20I win in terms of runs
Rossouw's departure was confirmed as he picked out Litton Das off Shakib
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mustafizur Rahman was the pick of the bowlers, finishing with 0 for 25 as he went for just two boundaries
Shakib Al Hasan had little luck with bat or ball
